title: Korean PGA ban golfer Bio Kim for THREE YEARS after he gave spectator the finger for taking picture
text:
The Korean Professional Golfers Association has banned Bio Kim for three years after he gave a spectator the middle finger.

The 29-year-old reacted angrily after one fan took a photo of his swing on the 16th hole at the DGB Financial Group Volvik Daegu Gyeongbuk Open.

Kim was distracted by the shutter sound of the camera and looked incandescent with rage as the ball sailed into the distance, gesturing and staring towards the culprit before slamming his club into the ground.

Bio Kim has been banned The Korean Professional Golfers Association for three years

The 29-year-old gestured and glared towards the fan before slamming his club into the turf

The tour's money leader held a narrow one-shot lead at the time of the incident.

It is illegal in South Korea for any phone company to sell mobiles that allow a user to silence the shutter sound on the cameras, and this unruly onlooker was clearly undeterred by the rule prohibiting fans from taking photos during the competition.

Kim won the tournament and has since apologised for his actions, but the KPGA decided to suspend Kim for three years from the tour and impose a fine of approximately £6,780.
